A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I am not sure what movie the critics saw\, but I think it was very different than the one that I was subjected to. The special effects and camera work are some of the best ever in a science fiction movie. However\, the plot and story - and what little dialogue there is - seem like they went with the first draft. (Edit: It turns out this was actually true\, unfortunately.) I had never walked out of a Star Wars movie feeling so overtly disappointed. Not only are celebrated characters\, subplots\, the build-up of the previous movie all senselessly thrown away\, but their replacements are thinner than an army of CGI soldiers. This episode of the greatest movie series of all time ends...with a kid and a broom? No wonder this movie had the greatest drop in the box office between the first and second weeks of release in motion picture history. Not only a disappointment\, not only a missed opportunity\, but the senseless discarding of decades of stories for nothing in return. The world would be a better place if it had not been made and we were still waiting for a sequel\, or none at all.
